intro: Languas sericea, commonly known as silky langues, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft appearance. Languas sericea is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
